author: Emily Dickinson
poem: Of Life to own --
From Life to draw --
But never tough the reservoir --

author: Emily Dickinson
poem: A Flower will not trouble her, it has so small a Foot,
And yet if you compare the Lasts,
Hers is the smallest Boot --

author: Emily Dickinson
poem: To see the Summer Sky
Is Poetry, though never in a Book it lie --
True Poems flee --

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
poem: Dear home, thou scene of earliest hopes and joys,
The least of which wronged Memory ever makes
Bitterer than all thine unremembered tears.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
poem: No, Music, thou art not the 'food of Love.'
Unless Love feeds upon its own sweet self,
Till it becomes all Music murmurs of.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
poem: O mighty mind, in whose deep stream this age
Shakes like a reed in the unheeding storm,
Why dost thou curb not thine own sacred rage?

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
poem: Rome has fallen, ye see it lying
Heaped in undistinguished ruin:
Nature is alone undying.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
poem: I went into the deserts of dim sleep--
That world which, like an unknown wilderness,
Bounds this with its recesses wide and deep--

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
poem: The babe is at peace within the womb;
The corpse is at rest within the tomb:
We begin in what we end.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
poem: Come, thou awakener of the spirit's ocean,
Zephyr, whom to thy cloud or cave
No thought can trace! speed with thy gentle motion!
